definition: to hit/to strike/to tap/to rap/to knock/to rip sb off/to overcharge
to tap/to knock lightly/old variant of 撲|扑[pu1]
to come to a decision/to fix on (a date etc)/to determine/to finalize/to nail down (a deal etc)
to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
lit. a brick as a door knocker (idiom); fig. a temporary expedient/to use sb as a stepping stone to fortune
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
a deliberate show of strength as a warning
to make a continual banging sound/(fig.) to provoke with words
to make a continual banging sound/(fig.) to provoke with words
extortion by taking advantage of sb's weakness
to back sb up/to support sb in an argument/(lit. to beat nearby drum)

sentences.english: The lady beaned me with her umbrella.
sentences.chinese: 那位女士拿傘敲我的腦袋。

sentences.english: The guy warned me that you have to knock on the door first to scatter them away.
sentences.chinese: 店員警告我說開門前最好先敲敲門，以便把它們嚇跑。

sentences.english: Even the children had to knock on the door for permission to go to the toilet.
sentences.chinese: 就連孩子們也得敲他們的們才能獲得許可去廁所。

sentences.english: After some furious finger tapping on the keyboard of a Personal Digital Assistant, Fei Fei leaned back in her chair.
sentences.chinese: 菲菲的手指在便攜式電腦鍵盤上飛快地敲着。

sentences.english: Miles grinned and shook his head while clicking his tongue against his teeth.
sentences.chinese: 邁爾斯搖着頭咧開嘴笑了，用舌頭敲着牙齒。

sentences.english: Nine men knock at the nice door near the net.
sentences.chinese: 九個男人在敲網子邊的那扇漂亮門。

sentences.english: Tony smiled to himself and drummed his fingers on the edge of the table.
sentences.chinese: 託尼暗自笑了一下，然後用手指在桌子邊沿敲了起來。

sentences.english: Mrs Rebuffed 2 people debate, o have tumbled down the stairs knocked at the end.
sentences.chinese: 太太回絕2人爭論中，阿得從樓梯上跌下來敲到頭。

sentences.english: He was squeezed out of 300 dollars.
The door was closed, so he knocked, but there was no answer.
sentences.chinese: 門緊閉着，他敲一下門，裏面沒有迴應。

sentences.english: Joe clinked his spoon against his glass as everyone took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 當大家就座時，喬用調羹敲了敲玻璃杯。

sentences.english: Joe clinked his spoon against his glass as everyone took their seats.
sentences.chinese: 當大家就座時，喬用調羹敲了敲玻璃杯。

sentences.english: It would strike twelve in twenty minutes time.
sentences.chinese: 還有廿分鐘它就該敲十二點了。

sentences.english: He knocked firmly on the door.
Osbaldiston jabbed his finger at it, harking hack to our conversation about Roger.
sentences.chinese: 奧斯鮑迪斯頓用手指敲着它回到剛纔關於羅傑的話題。

sentences.english: Usually, switching to the mid-grade or premium-grade gasoline will remove the knock.
sentences.chinese: 通常，切換到中等或以超值的汽油會刪除敲。

definition: to sound a bell/to raise the alarm
to get sth open by tapping or striking it/(figuratively, when followed by sth like ∼的大門|∼的大门) to open the door to ~/to gain access to ~
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to tap/to knock (against sth hard)/to knock (mud from boots, ashes from a pipe etc)

horizontal/across/crosswise/horizontal stroke (in Chinese characters)/to place (sth) flat (on a surface)/to cross (a river, etc)/in a jumble/chaotic/(in fixed expressions) harsh and unreasonable/violent
Dongdong, cheerleading mascot of 2008 Beijing Olympics
to push open (a gate etc)/to push away/to reject/to decline
